activities.message: Hi @blackni9ht - it seems that you did test this even though I specifically asked you not to. Other users are affected by your testing. I asked you to report the endpoint to us, not to do additional testing. Therefor, this report won't be eligible for a bounty. Please adhere to the rules or guidelines set by the program.

activities.message: I understand what you're saying, but common sense can be applied to understand that you shouldn't DoS H1 multiple times, regardless of your find. Your initial find showed the impact and we have a capable team to get to the root cause of these problems. If we would've had issues with it, we would've asked you do to more testing. Unfortunately, you kept testing even though I asked you specifically to complete stop testing, not to stop testing that particular find. Because of that I'm keeping this report marked as ineligible for a bounty.
activities.markdown_message: I understand what you're saying, but common sense can be applied to understand that you shouldn't DoS H1 multiple times, regardless of your find. Unfortunately, you kept testing even though I asked you specifically to complete stop testing, not to stop testing that particular find. Because of that I'm keeping this report marked as ineligible for a bounty.

activities.message: Hi @blackni9ht - I've created an exception for your to report it to our program. On a related note I'd like to ask you to be more patient in your reports, otherwise I'll have to lock the reports and remove the exception. We'll see your report come in soon. Thanks in advance. Regarding the report: we don't have an update yet. When we do, we'll let you know. I expect something next week.

activities.message: Hi @blackni9ht - I just wanted to give you an update from our side. We're still in the process of mitigating this vulnerability. We aim to have a fix in place next week. Thanks for your patience!

activities.message:
Hi @blackni9ht - we have updated the rate limiting settings for the affected endpoints. I've just tested the attack against multiple endpoints on our staging environment and there seems to be sufficient rate limiting in place at this point to avoid a DoS of the application. We'd like to thank you again for the report.

Regarding the bounty: we are sticking to our initial decision that we're not going to award a bounty for this issue. Even though you've shown us a legitimate vulnerability, the continuation of your attacks made us decide not to award you for it after we've asked multiple times to stop the attacks. I do want to acknowledge our mistake of not recognizing the initial problem you tried to report to us multiple times. We plan on changing our program's policy to make it clear what is allowed in this area. Regardless, continuing after we've asked multiple times to stop makes us stick with the initial decision.
activities.markdown_message:

I've just tested the attack against multiple endpoints on our staging environment and there seems to be sufficient rate limiting in place at this point to avoid a DoS of the application. We'd like to thank you again for the report.

Regarding the bounty: we are sticking to our initial decision that we're not going to award a bounty for this issue. Even though you've shown us a legitimate vulnerability, the continuation of your attacks made us decide not to award you for it after we've asked multiple times to stop the attacks. I do want to acknowledge our mistake of not recognizing the initial problem you tried to report to us multiple times. We plan on changing our program's policy to make it clear what is allowed in this area. Regardless, continuing after we've asked multiple times to stop makes us stick with the initial decision.

no i did not do that , as i said just one time to provide POC

Yes, no problem. We started by looking at the number of 500 errors returned from our backend. As can be seen in the screenshot below, there are two spikes:

The first one was right before you submitted this report. The second one, however, was after we've mentioned three times to refrain from any further testing (the first three responses in this report). We correlated the uptick in backend errors with requests made to the report in your PoC:

The IP addresses making those requests match with IP addresses linked to your account. The report in question was also filed by you, which happens to be the same user account that created this particular report.

We've decided to lock this report and, as per our policy, go ahead by disclosing this. In the future, please be mindful of program policies and requests made by the program members. We kindly ask you to make sure this will not happen again.
